identificationModule.briefTitle: Dario™ Blood Glucose Monitoring System - User Performance Evaluation
identificationModule.officialTitle: Dario™ Blood Glucose Monitoring System - User Performance Evaluation

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The study is performed to evaluate the accuracy of blood glucose level results obtained from fingertip using Labstyle Dario Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS) compared to reference equipment (YSI 2300 STATPLUS) and to evaluate the ease of use of the Dario Device by the lay-person.

The participants will review the Dario user manual and guide and will be requested to operate the Dario BGMS and perform their own glucose blood test, after which they will be asked to complete a questionnaire. As reference the participants will be tested by professional caregivers both using the Dario BGMS and by YSI 2003.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Device accuracy will be assessed based on the acceptance criteria of ISO 15197:2003 which states: "The minimum acceptable accuracy for results produced by a glucose monitoring system shall be as follows: 95% of the individual glucose results shall fall within 15 mg/dL of the results of Reference method at glucose concentrations ≥ 4,2 mmol/L (≥ 75 mg/dL)".

interventions.name: Dario™ Blood Glucose Meter
interventions.description: Each subject will undergo a finger prick and also provide a venous blood sample

interventions.name: YSI2003
interventions.description: Blood samples will be tested using YSI (gold standard) for comparison to evaluate accuracy.

primaryOutcomes.measure: BGMS Accuracy Assessment When Used by Layperson
primaryOutcomes.description: The minimum acceptable accuracy for results produced by a glucose monitoring system shall be as follows: 95% of the individual glucose results shall fall within 15 mg/dL of the results of reference method (YSI) at glucose concentrations ≥ 4,2 mmol/L (≥ 75 mg/dL). (ISO 15197:2003)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 6 seconds of applying blood drop to strip

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluation of the Ease of Use of the Dario BGMS by the Lay-person
secondaryOutcomes.description: Each participant receives a survey to fill in describing their usage of the device and their opinions on the ease of use.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within a couple of hours from the time labelling material was provided to the subject

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Male or female between the age 18 and 80
* Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes

Exclusion Criteria:

* Drug and alcohol abuse
* Investigator discretion

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: 230 patients were consented, the patients from day one (n=68) were excluded from the final results analysis due to a number of technical issues.

groups.title: Dario BGMS
groups.description:
Dario™ Blood Glucose Meter: Each subject will undergo a finger prick and also provide a venous blood sample

YSI2003: Blood samples will be tested using YSI (gold standard) for comparison to evaluate accuracy.

YSI2003: Blood samples will be tested using YSI (gold standard) for comparison to evaluate accuracy.

groups.title: Dario BGMS (Easily Understood)
groups.description:
Dario™ Blood Glucose Meter: Each subject will undergo a finger prick and also provide a venous blood sample. Subjects reported that the labels were easily understood.

YSI2003: Blood samples will be tested using YSI (gold standard) for comparison to evaluate accuracy.

groups.title: Dario BGMS (Understood After Few Attempts)
groups.description:
Dario™ Blood Glucose Meter: Each subject will undergo a finger prick and also provide a venous blood sample. Subjects reported that the labels were understood after few attempts.

YSI2003: Blood samples will be tested using YSI (gold standard) for comparison to evaluate accuracy.

groups.title: Dario BGMS (Did Not Understand How to Use)
groups.description:
Dario™ Blood Glucose Meter: Each subject will undergo a finger prick and also provide a venous blood sample. Subjects reported that the labels were not clear and that they did not understand how to use.

YSI2003: Blood samples will be tested using YSI (gold standard) for comparison to evaluate accuracy.
